title: Many Or Many Of | Grammar Exercise

questions.question: Nowadays there are ....................... families with disposable incomes.
questions.description: We use many before a noun and many of before a noun with a determiner.

questions.question: How …………….. students participated in the program?
questions.description: We use many before a noun and many of before a noun with a determiner.

questions.question: ……………… them arrived late.
questions.description: We use many of before a personal pronoun.

questions.question: …………….. us are disappointed with this decision.
questions.description: We use many of before a personal pronoun.

questions.question: There are ……………. people who want to be millionaires.
questions.description: We use many before a noun without a determiner.

questions.question: How …………….. you are traveling without tickets?
questions.description: We use many of before a pronoun.

questions.question: He has ……………. politicians among his friends.
questions.description: We use many before a noun without a determiner.

questions.question: How ……………….. us want a holiday?
questions.description: Before a personal pronoun we use many of.

questions.question: …………… are called few are chosen.
questions.description: Many can be used without a noun. This usage has the same meaning as many + noun.

questions.question: ……………… the students seemed unhappy.
questions.description: We use many of before a noun with an article or a determiner.
